     Any TOP SECRET violation on PANEXEC elements will be indicated by a
TOP SECRET message:
  TSS932E xxx ACCESS NOT GRANTED TO DATASET $PANX.panelib.grpname.eltname

    where: xxx  = the level of access required for the PANEXEC function
           panelib = the PANEXEC library name
           grpname = the group name of the element
           eltname = the element name being accessed

     Currently, the only PANEXEC library is 'HRA.LOADLIB' and the only group
on that library that applications development staff can access is 'TEST'.

     Update access to an element will be required for any action that
adds, deletes or changes elements on the library (e.g. the A, C, CH, CL,
L, M, R etc. options).  Read access authority to an element will be
required for any other action which otherwise accesses the element but
does not modify it (F, P, etc. options).

For further information on PANEXEC security in the batch environment
(including any restrictions when using the compile/linkedit option or the
library maintenance option) see the HRA/DPA PANEXEC Standard and Procedure.
)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp000a
)END

PXP000X.text:
%TUTORIAL -------------- PANEXEC DIAGNOSTICS -------------------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
   PANEXEC/ISPF can produce two types of diagnostics: dialog error
   messages and PANEXEC messages for all PANEXEC/ISPF dialog functions.

   All PANEXEC/ISPF dialog error messages are displayed in the upper
   right corner of the panel in which the error occurred. A longer
   second level explanatory message is sometimes available and is
   displayed by entering the HELP command. These messages are
   automatically produced when the dialog can diagnose an error prior
   to invoking PANEXEC or in response to a PANEXEC function failing.

   The PANEXEC messages may be used for diagnostic purposes when a PANEXEC
   function fails. These messages are fully documented in the PANEXEC SYSTEM
   REFERNCE MANUAL (APPENDIX B).  To turn PANEXEC mesaages on or off simply
   specify Y or N in the DIAGNOSE field of the primary PANEXEC utility panel.
   The recommended setting for this field is N, since PANEXEC messages are
   usually not needed and producing them adds to the PANEXEC overhead
   processing.  This field may be changed in the middle of a PANEXEC/ISPF
   session on the primary PANEXEC menu or by issuing the
                      DIAGNOSE {ON|OFF}
   command from the element selection list panel. If neither ON nor OFF is
   specified, ON is assumed.
)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp000a
)END

PXP000Y1.text:
%TUTORIAL -------------- PANEXEC GLOBAL FACILITIES--------------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+  The PANEXEC global facilities are:
     PANEXEC LOADER
     DYNAMIC BLDL
     PDS COMPATIBILITY (CICS)
     SECURITY EXIT MANAGER

+  These facilities are described in detail in the PANEXEC SYSTEM REFERENCE
   MANUAL in Chapter 10 'INSTALLATION' (P. 10-16 thru 10-39) and will not be
   further discussed in this tutorial except to clarify the operation of this
   PANEXEC/ISPF panel. The panel requires that a JOB statement be completed
   since the global facilities functions are executed as a batch job.

   The global facilities panel should be accessibile only to your systems
   programming staff for the purpose of activating/deactivating or modifying
   any of the above facilities. This requires that the systems programmer be
   aware of the options chosen in the PANEOPT macro when PANEXEC was installed.

   To activate/deactivate/report on ALL PANEXEC global facilities simply
   enter the A/D/R option on the command line.  (Be sure to quiese the
   system prior to deactivating PANEXEC).
                         (continued on next page)
)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp000a
   &zcont = pxp000y2
)END

PXP000Y2.text:
%TUTORIAL -------------- PANEXEC GLOBAL FACILITIES--------------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
   To modify any individual facilities fill in the appropiate prompts
   in the remainder of the panel.

   Whenever a facility is modified the following default actions will apply
   when an explicit option has not been coded for a required panel field:

   PANEXEC LOADER Source:   A (STEPLIB of the XLLARS started task)
   PANEXEC LOADER Release:  D (Default release)
   DYNAMIC BLDL Table Type: P (PANEOPT Default)
   DYNAMIC BLDL Entries:    P (PANEOPT Default)
   PDS COMPATIBILITY Targets: A (ALL)
   SECURITY Exits:          A (ALL)

   This panel does NOT support entry of fields specific to MVS/XA.

   All activity performed through the global facilities panel will be reported
   (in summary or detail) to the a destination (console or file defined in the
   XLLARS started task) defined by the REPORT macro in the PANEOPT macro.

   The following topics are presented only if selected by number:
        1 - XLLARS started task
)PROC
   &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD
                1,*pxp000y3
                )
   &ZUP = pxp000a
)END

PXP000Z.text:
%TUTORIAL -------------- PANEXEC - CLEAR PANEL FIELDS ----------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+  The%clear panel fields+ function is used to clear the GROUP, ELEMENT,
   TYPE, STATUS and MODE fields on the primary PANEXEC utility panel and
   place an 'S' in the OPTION field. (The user must hit the ENTER key to
   invoke the 'S' option, if so desired).

   The 'X' option provides a convenient method of producing an element
   selection list on an entire PANEXEC library named in the DATASET NAME
   field without having to bring the cursor down and individually
   clearing unwanted fields.

)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp000a
)END

PXP0000.text:
)ATTR
  % TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  + TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)
)BODY
%-------------------  PANEXEC LIBRARY UTILITY  ---------------------------------
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                               +DIAGNOSE =>_Z+
%                                                                     +LOG =>_Z+
%   S+- Display element selection list%A+- Add           %B+- Browse
%   C+- Copy                          %CL+- Compile/Lked %D+- Delete
%   CH+- Change directory information %IN+- Input PROC   %E+- Edit
%   F+- Fetch (retrieve)              %M+- Modify mode   %P+- Print
%   PM+- Promote to prod status       %R+- Rename        %T+- Transfer
%   L+- Library Maintenance           %I+- Library info  %Z+- Zap (Load module
%   G+- Global Facilities             %X+- Clear panel fields   Map/XREF/Stats)
%   END+- Exit PANEXEC
+
+PANEXEC LIBRARY:
+   DATASET NAME %===>_PXPDSN                                      +
+   GROUP   %===>_PXPGRP  +
+   ELEMENT %===>_PXPELT  +
+   TYPE    %===>_Z   +      STATUS  %===>_Z+         MODE  %===>_Z+
+
+   VOLUME SERIAL %===>_PXPVOL+       (If not cataloged)
+   NEW ELEMENT   %===>_PXPNEWNM+  NEW GROUP %===>_pxpnewgp+ (If "R" selected)
+   NEW MODE      %===>_Z+            (If "M" selected)
+   SYSOUT CLASS  %===>_Z+            (If "P" selected)
+   DISPLAY VIEW  %===>_Z+(S=Short,L=Long) (If "S" selected)
+   CONFIRM DELETE%===>_Z+ (Y or N)   (If "D" selected)
)INIT
  .HELP = PXP000a
  .ZVARS = '(PXPDIAG,pxplog,PXPTYPE,PXPSTAT,PXPMODE,PXPNEWMD,PXPSSOUT, +
             pxpsview,pxpconf)'
  /* .CURSOR = ZCMD     */
  &zprim = yes
  &PXPNEWNM = &Z
  &PXPNEWMD = &Z
  &PXPNEWGP = &Z
  &PXPsview = S
  IF ( &PXPDSN = ' ' )
    &PXPVOL = &Z

  &YZA  =  'A '     /* ADD                                  */
  &YZB  =  'B '     /* BROWSE                               */
  &YZC  =  'C '     /* COPY                                 */
  &YZCH =  'CH'     /* CHANGE DIRECTORY                     */
  &YZCL =  'CL'     /* COMPILE/LKED                         */
  &YZD  =  'D '     /* DELETE                               */
  &YZE  =  'E '     /* EDIT CNTL ELEMENTS                   */
  &YZF  =  'F '     /* FETCH                                */
  &YZG  =  'G '     /* SYSTEMS PROGRAMMER FUNCTION-global facil */
  &YZI  =  'I '     /* LIBRARY INFO                         */
  &YZIN =  'IN'     /* INPUT PROC                           */
  &YZL  =  'L '     /* LIBRARY MAINTENANCE                  */
  &YZM  =  'M '     /* MODIGY MODE                          */
  &YZP  =  'P '     /* PRINT                                */
  &YZPM =  'PM'     /* PROMOTE TO PROD                      */
  &YZR  =  'R '     /* RENAME                               */
  &YZS  =  'S '     /* DIRECTORY LIST                       */
  &YZT  =  'T '     /* TRANSFER                             */
  &YZX  =  'X '     /* clear panel fields                   */
  &YZZ  =  'Z '     /* ZAP                                  */

)PROC
  VER(&ZCMD,NB,LIST,A, B, C, CH,CL,D,E,F, I, IN, L, M, P, PM, R, S, T,Z,
                    G, X, MSG=PXP013)
  VER(&PXPDIAG,LIST, N,Y ,msg=pxp014)
  VER(&PXPLOG,LIST, N,Y ,msg=pxp014)
  VER(&PXPDSN,NB,DSNAME)
  IF (&ZCMD =  A, B, C, CH, D, E, F, I, M, P, PM, R, Z)
    VER(&PXPELT,NB, msg=pxp015)
  IF (&ZCMD = CL)
    VER(&PXPTYPE,LIST, EXEC, MSG=PXP021)
  IF (&ZCMD = D)
    VER(&PXPMODE,NB ,LIST, D, I, msg=pxp016)
    VER(&PXPCONF,NB ,LIST, Y, N)
  IF (&ZCMD = E)
    VER(&PXPTYPE,NB ,LIST, CNTL ,msg=pxp017)
    VER(&PXPSTAT,LIST, T ,msg=pxp017)
    VER(&PXPMODE,LIST, A ,msg=pxp017)
  IF (&ZCMD = M)
    VER(&PXPNEWMD, LIST, A, D, I ,msg=pxp018)   /* NB removed */
  IF (&ZCMD = P)
    VER(&PXPSSOUT,NB)
  IF (&ZCMD = PM)
    VER(&PXPstat ,LIST, T ,msg=pxp019)
  /* IF (&ZCMD = R)                               */
  /*    IF (&PXPNEWGP = ' ')                      */
  /*        VER(&PXPNEWNM,NB)                     */
  IF (&ZCMD = S)
     VER(&PXPSVIEW, LIST,S,L ,msg=pxp020)
  IF (&ZCMD = Z)
    VER(&PXPTYPE, LIST, EXEC ,msg=pxp021)
  VPUT (PXPDIAG,PXPLOG,PXPDSN,PXPGRP,PXPELT,PXPSTAT,PXPMODE,PXPSSOUT,
        PXPtype,pxpconf) profile
)END

PXP0001.text:
)ATTR
  % TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  + TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
)BODY
%--PANEXEC LIB/ELT= &PXPDSN &PXPGRP..&PXPELT/&pxptype;&pxpstat&pxpmode----------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+SPECIFY%"&FUNC" PANEXEC LIBRARY or data set BELOW.
+
+PANEXEC LIBRARY: (FOR COPY/TRANSFER/INPUT ONLY)
+   DATA SET NAME %===>_PXPDSN2
+   GROUP   %===>_PXPGRP2 +
+   ELEMENT %===>_PXPELT2 +
+   STATUS  %===>_Z+             MODE   %===>_Z+
+
+PARTITIONED OR SEQUENTIAL DATA SET: (FOR ADD/FETCH/INPUT ONLY)
+   DATA SET NAME %===>_DSN2                                       +
+   MEMBER        %===>_MEMB    +
+
+   VOLUME SERIAL %===>_vol2  + (If not cataloged)
+
+OPTIONS:
+   REPLACE LIKE-NAMED ELEMENTS ON ADD/COPY/TRANSFER %===>_Z+ (Y or N)
+   EXPAND EMBEDDED INCLUDEs ON "FETCH"              %===>_Z+ (Y or N)
+   IF SEQUENTIAL, "FETCH TO" DATA SET DISP %===>_disp+   (OLD or MOD)
+   INPUT PARMS ('IN' opt)%===>_PXPARMS                                        +
)INIT
  &ZCMD = &Z
  .HELP = pxp001a1
  .ZVARS = '(PXPSTAT2,PXPMODE2,PXPREPL,PXPEXPND)'
  &DISP = TRANS (&ZUSD M,'MOD' O,'OLD')
  &FUNC = TRANS(trunc(&pxpfunc,1) F,FETCH-to  A,ADD-from
                      C,COPY-to   T,TRANSFER-to)
  IF (&PXPFUNC = ' ')
      &func = INPUT-from
)PROC
  IF  (&PXPDSN2 = ' ')
       &PXPDSN2 = '''HRA.PANESRL'''
  VER (&PXPDSN2,DSNAME)
  IF  (&DSN2 ¬= ' ')
      VER (&DSN2,DSNAME)
  IF  (&MEMB ¬= ' ')
      VER (&MEMB,NAME)
  VER (&PXPREPL, LIST, ' ',Y,N ,msg=pxp022)
  VER (&PXPEXPND, LIST, ' ',Y,N ,msg=pxp022)
  &ZUSD = TRUNC (&DISP,1)
  &DISP = TRANS (&ZUSD M,'MOD' O,'OLD')
  VPUT ( PXPDSN2 PXPGRP2 PXPSTAT2 PXPMODE2 PXPREPL) PROFILE
  VPUT ( DSN2 PXPEXPND ZUSD ) PROFILE
)END

PXP0005.text:
)ATTR
  % TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  + TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)
)BODY
%---------------------PANEXEC COMPILE/LINK-EDIT --------------------------------
%--PANEXEC LIB/ELT= &PXPDSN &PXPGRP..&PXPELT/&PXPTYPE;&PXPSTAT&PXPMODE----------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+SPECIFY COMPILE/LINK-EDIT PARAMETERS AND OPTIONS BELOW.
+ SOURCE LANGUAGE     ===>_Z   + (ASM, CVS, FORT, OPT, PL1 or LK)
+ TRANSLATOR OPTIONS  ===>_PXPOPT                                              +
+ LINK-EDITOR OPTIONS ===>_PXPLKOPT                                            +
+ TRANSLATE WITHOUT LINK-EDITING        %===>_Z+ (Y or N)
+ MACRO/COPY LIBRARIES REQUIRED         %===>_Z+ (Y or N)
+ LINK-EDIT CONTROL STATEMENTS REQUIRED %===>_Z+ (Y or N)
+                                                                              +
+PANVALET LIBRARY: ('HRA.SOURCE' for test PANVALET)
+   DATA SET NAME %===>_PVDSN
+   MEMBER        %===>_PVMBR     +
+PARTITIONED or SEQUENTIAL DATA SET:
+   DATA SET NAME %===>_NOPVDSN                                    +
+   MEMBER        %===>_NOPVMBR +
+   VOLUME SERIAL %===>_nopvol+ (IF NOT CATALOGED)
+
+JOB STATEMENT INFORMATION:
+  ===>_pxpjobc1
+  ===>_pxpjobc2
+  ===>_pxpjobc3
)INIT
  &ZCMD = &Z
  .HELP = pxp000l1
  .ZVARS = '(PXPLANG,NOLK,pxpmacro,LKCTL)'
)PROC
  VER (&PXPLANG, NB, LIST, ASM, CVS, PL1, FORT, OPT, LK ,MSG=PXP023)
  VER (&NOLK,nb, LIST, Y,N ,msg=pxp024)
  VER (&LKCTL,nb, LIST, Y,N ,msg=pxp024)
  VER (&pxpmacro,nb, LIST, Y,N ,msg=pxp024)
  VER (&PXPJOBC1,NB)
  VER (&PVDSN,DSNAME)
  VER (&NOPVDSN,DSNAME)
  VER (&NOPVMBR,NAME)
  IF (&PXPOPT = ' ')
      &PXPOPT = ''','''
  IF (&PXPLKOPT = ' ')
      &PXPLKOPT = ''','''
  &PXPNOLK  = TRANS (&NOLK  N,N       Y,NOLKED)
  &PXPLKCTL = TRANS (&LKCTL N,NOLKCTL Y,PANELIN)
  VPUT (PXPJOBC1 PXPJOBC2 PXPJOBC3 pxpmacro) PROFILE
  VPUT (PXPLANG PVDSN NOPVDSN PXPOPT PXPLKOPT NOLK LKCTL) PROFILE
)END

PXP0007.text:
)ATTR
  % TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  + TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)
)BODY
%-------------------  PANEXEC LIBRARY MAINTENACE -------------------------------
%--PANEXEC LIB/ELT= &PXPDSN &PXPGRP..&PXPELT/&PXPTYPE;&PXPSTAT&PXPMODE----------
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
%   B+- Backup (with directory reports)    M+- Modify attributes
%   C+- Create                             R+- Restore
%   D+- Delete inactive elements           V+- Convert a PDS
+
%PANEXEC LIBRARY INFO (DSN, GROUP, ELT, ETC.) MUST BE SUPPLIED ON THE MAIN MENU!
+FILE OPTIONS:
+   Retention Period         %===>_Z   +        ("B" or "D" Option)
+   Volume Serial            %===>_libcvL+      ("C" Option)
+   Space Allocation (in CYL)%===>_libcyl+      ("C" Option)
+   Maximum Elements         %===>_libmxelt+    ("C" Option)
+   File Update Options      %===>_z   +        ("M" Option)
+   Replace Like-named Elements%=>_Z+  (Y or N) ("R" Option)
+   GDG Number:      Relative%===>_Z   +or Absolute%=>_z   +     ("R" Option)
+   PDS Name %===>_libpds                                     +  ("V" Option)
+   PDS Volume Serial        %===>_pdsvol+ (If not cataloged)    ("V" Option)
+
+JOB STATEMENT INFORMATION:
+  ===>_libjobc1
+  ===>_libjobc2
+  ===>_libjobc3
)INIT
  .HELP = PXP000j1
  .ZVARS = '(LIBRETPD,LIBFUPDT,LIBRREP,LIBGDG,libgdgab)'
  .CURSOR = ZCMD
  &LIBRETPD = 7
  &LIBRREP  = N

)PROC
  VER(&ZCMD,nb,LIST, B, C, D, M, R, V ,msg=pxp025)
  VER(&LIBJOBC1,NB)
  IF (&ZCMD = B, D)
    VER(&LIBRETPD,nb,NUM)
  IF (&ZCMD = C)
    VER(&LIBCVL,NB)
    VER(&LIBCYL,nb,NUM)
    VER(&LIBMXELT,nb,NUM)
  IF (&ZCMD = M)
    VER(&LIBFUPDT,NB)
  IF (&ZCMD = R)
    VER(&LIBRREP,nb, LIST, Y, N ,msg=pxp022)
    if (&libgdgab = ' ')
        VER(&LIBGDG,enum)
    else
        VER(&LIBGDGAB,NUM)
        VER(&LIBGDGAB,LEN,'=',4)
  IF (&ZCMD = V)
    VER(&LIBPDS,nb,DSNAME)
  VPUT (LIBjobc1,libjobc2,libjobc3,libgdg) PROFILE
)END

PXP0008.text:
%-------- PANEXEC ADDITIONAL MACRO/COPY LIBRARIES FOR COMPILE/LKED -------------

PXP0009.text:
)ATTR
  % TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  + TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)
)BODY
%--PANEXEC ZAP/ELT= &PXPDSN &PXPGRP..&PXPELT/&PXPTYPE;&PXPSTAT&PXPMODE----------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+OUTPUT ZAPPED ELEMENT: (COMPLETE ONLY IF DIFFERENT FROM INPUT ELEMENT)
+   GROUP   %===>_PXPzpgrp+
+   ELEMENT %===>_PXPzpelt+
+   STATUS  %===>_Z+             MODE   %===>_Z+
+
+SPECIFY ZAP OPTIONS %====>_Z     + (Any combination of C, M, N, R, S, X)
+                                   (M=Map, S=Statistics, X=XREF and Map)
+SPECIFY ZAP SUBCOMMANDS BELOW. (CSECT, BASE, IDRDATA, VER, REP)
+  ===>_pxpzap1                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap2                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap3                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap4                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap5                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap6                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap7                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap8                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap9                                                                +
+  ===>_pxpzap10                                                               +
+  ===>_pxpzap11                                                               +
+  ===>_pxpzap12                                                               +
+  ===>_pxpzap13                                                               +
)INIT
  &ZCMD = &Z
  .HELP = pxp000t2
  .zvars = '(pxpzpst pxpzpmod pxpzpopt)'
)PROC
  VPUT (PXPzpgrp PXPzpst PXPzpmod pxpzpopt) PROFILE
)END

PXP001A1.text:
%TUTORIAL -----PANEXEC- COPY/TRANSFER/ADD/FETCH/INPUT ---SECOND PANEL---TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+  Fill in the following fields on the%second panel:

       - If the%"C" or "T" option has been requested:+
         Enter the%"to"+PANEXEC library information in the appropriate
         fields. If the "T" option was requested, the "to" library must
         be different than the "from" library.

       - If the%"A" or "F" option has been requested:+
         Enter the%"from" or "to"+PDS (together with member name) or
         sequential data set information in the appropriate fields.

       - If the%"IN" option has been requested:+
         Enter the source of input procedure as either coming from a
         PANEXEC library or from a PDS or sequential data set. If a
         PANEXEC element name is specified, the input procedure will be
         obtained from there, otherwise, it will be obtained from the
         PDS (if a member name is specified) or sequential data set.

         NOTE that if INput procedure REPORTS is executed, files EZTIN
         and FILEA will be automatically allocated by the dialog.
                   (continued on next page)
)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp000a
   &Zcont = pxp001a2
)END

PXP001A2.text:
%TUTORIAL -----PANEXEC- COPY/TRANSFER/ADD/FETCH/INPUT ---SECOND PANEL---TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+  Enter or verify the following options on the %second panel:
       - If the%"A", "C", or "T" option has been requested:+
           -  Replace like-named elements ===>
                Enter%Y+to allow replacement of elements in the library.
                Enter%N+to prevent replacement of elements in the library.

       - If the%"F" option has been requested:+
           -  Expand embedded INCLUDEs   ===>
                Enter%Y+to expand embedded INCLUDEs
                Enter%N+to suppress expansion of embedded INCLUDEs

       - If the%"FETCH-to"+data set is%sequential:+
           -  "To" data set disposition  ===>
                Enter%OLD+to overwrite existing data in the data set.
                Enter%MOD+to add to the end of the data set.

       - If the%"IN" option has been requested:+
           -  INput parm  ===>
           NOTE that the parameter list should NOT be enclosed in quotes.
           Individual parms may be enclosed in quotes if they contain
           special characters. E.G., =====> parm1,'parm-2'
)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp001a2
)END

PXP0010.text:
)ATTR
  % TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  + TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)
)BODY
%---------------------PANEXEC GLOBAL FACILITIES --------------------------------
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+  %A+- Activate%ALL+PANEXEC global facilities
+  %D+- Deactivate%ALL+PANEXEC global facilities
+  %R+- Report on%ALL+PANEXEC global facilities
+
+  PANEXEC LOADER %===>_Z+ (A=Activate,D=Deactivate)
+     Source %===>_z+ (A=STEPLIB,P=LPA,D=PANEIPL Internal Default)             +
+     Release%===>_z +(2 char release number (e.g. 52) or D (default))         +
+                                                                              +
+  DYNAMIC BLDL %===>_Z+ (A=Activate,F=Refresh,D=Deactivate)
+     Table Type%===>_Z+ (D=DYNAMIC,L=XLLA,P=PANEOPT Default,R=Preloaded)      +
+     Entries%==>_Z    +(Max table entries or P=PANEOPT Default for DYNAMIC)   +
+
+  PDS COMPATIBILITY (CICS)%===>_Z+ (A=Activate,D=Deactivate)
+     Target names: 1)_target1 +2)_target2 +3)_target3 + (A=ALL targets)       +
+
+  SECURITY EXITS %===>_Z+ (A=Activate,D=Deactivate)
+     Exit names:   1)_exit1   +2)_exit2   +3)_exit3   + (A=ALL exits)         +
+
+JOB STATEMENT INFORMATION:
+  ===>_SPJOBC1
+  ===>_SPJOBC2
+  ===>_SPJOBC3
)INIT
  &ZCMD = &Z
  .HELP = PXP000Y1
  .CURSOR = ZCMD
  .ZVARS = '(SPLOADER,SPSOURCE,SPRELEAS,SPBLDL,SPTABTYP,SPENTRES,      +
             SPPDSC,SPSECURE)'
)PROC
  VER (&ZCMD,LIST, A, D, R)
  VER (&SPLOADER,LIST, A, D)
  VER (&SPBLDL,LIST, A, D, F)
  VER (&SPPDSC,LIST, A, D)
  VER (&SPSECURE,LIST, A, D)
  VER (&SPSOURCE,LIST, A, D, P)
  VER (&SPTABTYP,LIST, D, L, P, R)
  VER (&SPRPTDST,LIST, C, F, T)
  VER (&SPRPTTYP,LIST, D, P, S)
  IF  (&SPLOADER = A)
      IF  (&SPSOURCE = ' ')
           &SPSOURCE = A
      IF  (&SPRELEAS = ' ')
           &SPRELEAS = D
      IF  (&SPRELEAS ¬= D)
           VER(&SPRELEAS,NB,NUM)
  IF  (&SPBLDL = A)
      IF  (&SPTABTYP = ' ')
           &SPTABTYP = P
  IF  (&SPTABTYP = D)
      IF  (&SPENTRES = ' ')
           &SPENTRES = P
      IF  (&SPENTRES ¬= P)
           VER(&SPENTRES,NB,NUM)
  IF  (&SPPDSC ¬= ' ')
      IF  (&TARGET1 = ' ')
           &TARGET1 = A
  IF  (&SPSECURE ¬= ' ')
      IF  (&EXIT1 = ' ')
           &EXIT1 = A
  VER(&SPJOBC1,NB)
  VPUT (SPJOBC1,SPJOBC2,SPJOBC3) PROFILE
)END

PXP002A.text:
%TUTORIAL --------- PANEXEC LIBRARY UTILITY - CONFIRM DELETE----------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+  The%confirm delete+panel is used to confirm that you really want to
   delete an element from a PANEXEC library following a delete element
   request.  If you want to delete the element, press the ENTER key.  If
   you made a mistake and do not want to delete the element, enter the
   END command.

   The following command, which may be entered on the element selection
   list panel, can be used to suppress or force the showing of the
   confirm delete panel following a delete element request:
          CONFIRM {ON|OFF}
   CONFIRM ON forces the showing of the confirm delete panel. CONFIRM
   OFF suppresses the showing of the confirm delete panel. If neither
   ON nor OFF is specified, ON is assummed.
)PROC
   &ZUP = pxp000r
)END
